Description: The Federal Trade Commission announced that Skechers USA, Inc. agreed to pay $40 million to settle charges that the company deceived consumers by making unfounded claims that Shape-ups would help people lose weight, and strengthen and tone their buttocks, legs and abdominal muscles.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles
Private Litigation Case Title: Roneshia Sayles v. Skechers USA Inc.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Orange
Notes: The settlement also covered two other cases filed in Superior Court in Los Angeles County: MYRNA CORTEZ v. SKECHERS USA, INC (BC290932) and another by the same name (BC318101).

Description: Skechers paid $5,000,000 to settle multistate allegations that it improperly advertised that its footwear with rounded soles would help consumers lose weight and strengthen muscles. The company separately reached a $40 million settlement with the Federal Trade Commission; see separate Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-skechers-usa-inc
